entries.name: heme binding
entries.def: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with heme, any compound of iron complexed in a porphyrin (tetrapyrrole) ring.

entries.name: oxidoreductase activity, acting on paired donors, with incorporation or reduction of molecular oxygen
entries.def: Catalysis of an oxidation-reduction (redox) reaction in which hydrogen or electrons are transferred from each of two donors, and molecular oxygen is reduced or incorporated into a donor.

entries.name: iron ion binding
entries.def: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with iron (Fe) ions.

entries.name: monooxygenase activity
entries.def: Catalysis of the incorporation of one atom from molecular oxygen into a compound and the reduction of the other atom of oxygen to water.

entries.name: regulation of 1-deoxy-D-xylulose-5-phosphate synthase activity
entries.def: Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of 1-deoxy-D-xylulose-5-phosphate synthase activity.

entries.name: chaperone-mediated protein folding
entries.def: The process of inhibiting aggregation and assisting in the covalent and noncovalent assembly of single chain polypeptides or multisubunit complexes into the correct tertiary structure that is dependent on interaction with a chaperone.

entries.name: regulation of isopentenyl diphosphate biosynthetic process, methylerythritol 4-phosphate pathway
entries.def: Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of the chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the formation of isopentenyl diphosphate produced via the methylerythritol (MEP) pathway (mevalonate-independent).

entries.name: chloroplast
entries.def: A chlorophyll-containing plastid with thylakoids organized into grana and frets, or stroma thylakoids, and embedded in a stroma.

entries.name: nucleus
entries.def: A membrane-bounded organelle of eukaryotic cells in which chromosomes are housed and replicated. In most cells, the nucleus contains all of the cell's chromosomes except the organellar chromosomes, and is the site of RNA synthesis and processing. In some species, or in specialized cell types, RNA metabolism or DNA replication may be absent.

entries.name: pyridoxal phosphate binding
entries.def: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with pyridoxal 5' phosphate, 3-hydroxy-5-(hydroxymethyl)-2-methyl4-pyridine carboxaldehyde 5' phosphate, the biologically active form of vitamin B6.

entries.name: carboxy-lyase activity
entries.def: Catalysis of the nonhydrolytic addition or removal of a carboxyl group to or from a compound.

entries.name: carboxylic acid metabolic process
entries.def: The chemical reactions and pathways involving carboxylic acids, any organic acid containing one or more carboxyl (COOH) groups or anions (COO-).

entries.name: endoplasmic reticulum membrane
entries.def: The lipid bilayer surrounding the endoplasmic reticulum.

entries.name: sphinganine-1-phosphate aldolase activity
entries.def: Catalysis of the reaction: sphinganine 1-phosphate = phosphoethanolamine + palmitaldehyde.

entries.name: sphingolipid catabolic process
entries.def: The chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the breakdown of sphingolipids, any of a class of lipids containing the long-chain amine diol sphingosine or a closely related base (a sphingoid).

entries.name: integral component of membrane
entries.def: The component of a membrane consisting of the gene products and protein complexes having at least some part of their peptide sequence embedded in the hydrophobic region of the membrane.

entries.name: copper ion binding
entries.def: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with copper (Cu) ions.

entries.name: oxidoreductase activity, oxidizing metal ions
entries.def: Catalysis of an oxidation-reduction in which the oxidation state of metal ion is altered.

entries.name: plasma membrane
entries.def: The membrane surrounding a cell that separates the cell from its external environment. It consists of a phospholipid bilayer and associated proteins.

entries.name: plasmodesma
entries.def: A fine cytoplasmic channel, found in all higher plants, that connects the cytoplasm of one cell to that of an adjacent cell.

entries.name: translation
entries.def: The cellular metabolic process in which a protein is formed, using the sequence of a mature mRNA or circRNA molecule to specify the sequence of amino acids in a polypeptide chain. Translation is mediated by the ribosome, and begins with the formation of a ternary complex between aminoacylated initiator methionine tRNA, GTP, and initiation factor 2, which subsequently associates with the small subunit of the ribosome and an mRNA or circRNA. Translation ends with the release of a polypeptide chain from the ribosome.

entries.name: rRNA binding
entries.def: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with ribosomal RNA.

entries.name: ribosomal small subunit assembly
entries.def: The aggregation, arrangement and bonding together of constituent RNAs and proteins to form the small ribosomal subunit.

entries.name: mRNA binding
entries.def: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with messenger RNA (mRNA), an intermediate molecule between DNA and protein. mRNA includes UTR and coding sequences, but does not contain introns.

entries.name: structural constituent of ribosome
entries.def: The action of a molecule that contributes to the structural integrity of the ribosome.

entries.name: cytosolic small ribosomal subunit
entries.def: The small subunit of a ribosome located in the cytosol.

rapdb.Oryzabase Gene Name Synonym(s): ribosomal protein S5, ribosomal protein small subunit 5

entries.name: phospholipid catabolic process
entries.def: The chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the breakdown of phospholipids, any lipid containing phosphoric acid as a mono- or diester.

entries.name: acid phosphatase activity
entries.def: Catalysis of the reaction: an orthophosphoric monoester + H2O = an alcohol + phosphate, with an acid pH optimum.

entries.name: integral component of membrane
entries.def: The component of a membrane consisting of the gene products and protein complexes having at least some part of their peptide sequence embedded in the hydrophobic region of the membrane.

entries.name: RNA modification
entries.def: The covalent alteration of one or more nucleotides within an RNA molecule to produce an RNA molecule with a sequence that differs from that coded genetically.

entries.name: zinc ion binding
entries.def: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with zinc (Zn) ions.

entries.name: RNA binding
entries.def: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with an RNA molecule or a portion thereof.

entries.name: intracellular membrane-bounded organelle
entries.def: Organized structure of distinctive morphology and function, bounded by a single or double lipid bilayer membrane and occurring within the cell. Includes the nucleus, mitochondria, plastids, vacuoles, and vesicles. Excludes the plasma membrane.

entries.name: endonuclease activity
entries.def: Catalysis of the hydrolysis of ester linkages within nucleic acids by creating internal breaks.

entries.name: protein kinase activity
entries.def: Catalysis of the phosphorylation of an amino acid residue in a protein, usually according to the reaction: a protein + ATP = a phosphoprotein + ADP.

entries.name: ATP binding
entries.def: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with ATP, adenosine 5'-triphosphate, a universally important coenzyme and enzyme regulator.

entries.name: magnesium ion binding
entries.def: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with magnesium (Mg) ions.

entries.name: acireductone synthase activity
entries.def: Catalysis of the reactions: 5-(methylthio)-2,3-dioxopentyl phosphate + H2O = 1,2-dihydroxy-5-(methylthio)pent-1-en-3-one + phosphate; (1a) 5-(methylthio)-2,3-dioxopentyl phosphate = 2-hydroxy-5-(methylthio)-3-oxopent-1-enyl phosphate; (1b) 2-hydroxy-5-(methylthio)-3-oxopent-1-enyl phosphate + H2O = 1,2-dihydroxy-5-(methylthio)pent-1-en-3-one + phosphate.

entries.name: L-methionine salvage from methylthioadenosine
entries.def: The generation of L-methionine (2-amino-4-(methylthio)butanoic acid) from methylthioadenosine.

entries.name: protein binding
entries.def: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with any protein or protein complex (a complex of two or more proteins that may include other nonprotein molecules).

entries.name: integral component of membrane
entries.def: The component of a membrane consisting of the gene products and protein complexes having at least some part of their peptide sequence embedded in the hydrophobic region of the membrane.

entries.name: hydrolase activity, acting on ester bonds
entries.def: Catalysis of the hydrolysis of any ester bond.

entries.name: metabolic process
entries.def: The chemical reactions and pathways, including anabolism and catabolism, by which living organisms transform chemical substances. Metabolic processes typically transform small molecules, but also include macromolecular processes such as DNA repair and replication, and protein synthesis and degradation.

entries.name: snRNA import into nucleus
entries.def: The directed movement of snRNA, small nuclear ribonucleic acid into the nucleus.

entries.name: nucleus
entries.def: A membrane-bounded organelle of eukaryotic cells in which chromosomes are housed and replicated. In most cells, the nucleus contains all of the cell's chromosomes except the organellar chromosomes, and is the site of RNA synthesis and processing. In some species, or in specialized cell types, RNA metabolism or DNA replication may be absent.

entries.name: cytoplasm
entries.def: All of the contents of a cell excluding the plasma membrane and nucleus, but including other subcellular structures.

entries.name: GTPase activator activity
entries.def: Binds to and increases the activity of a GTPase, an enzyme that catalyzes the hydrolysis of GTP.

entries.name: Rab GTPase binding
entries.def: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with Rab protein, any member of the Rab subfamily of the Ras superfamily of monomeric GTPases.

entries.name: intracellular protein transport
entries.def: The directed movement of proteins in a cell, including the movement of proteins between specific compartments or structures within a cell, such as organelles of a eukaryotic cell.

entries.name: regulation of vesicle fusion
entries.def: Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of vesicle fusion.

entries.name: activation of GTPase activity
entries.def: Any process that initiates the activity of an inactive GTPase through the replacement of GDP by GTP.

entries.name: intracellular
entries.def: The living contents of a cell; the matter contained within (but not including) the plasma membrane, usually taken to exclude large vacuoles and masses of secretory or ingested material. In eukaryotes it includes the nucleus and cytoplasm.

entries.name: endomembrane system
entries.def: A collection of membranous structures involved in transport within the cell. The main components of the endomembrane system are endoplasmic reticulum, Golgi bodies, vesicles, cell membrane and nuclear envelope. Members of the endomembrane system pass materials through each other or though the use of vesicles.
